properties.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 2 at 2:09AM CST until February 2 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Dodge City KS
properties.description:
...RED FLAG CONDITIONS LIKELY THIS AFTERNOON...

.Relative humidity in the 10 to 15 percent range combined with
wind gusts in excess of 20 mph will create significant wildfire
risk afternoon.

The National Weather Service in Dodge City has issued a Red Flag
Warning For wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect
from noon CST /11 AM MST/ today to 6 PM CST /5 PM MST/ this
evening.

* Affected Area...In Kansas...Fire Weather Zone 061 Hamilton...
Fire Weather Zone 062 Kearny...Fire Weather Zone 074 Stanton
and Fire Weather Zone 084 Morton.

* Winds...South at 15 mph with gusts around to 25 mph.

* Relative Humidity...As low as 10 percent.

* Impacts...Any fires that start will have extreme fire behavior
and spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not advised.
properties.instruction:
A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions
are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of
strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can
contribute to extreme fire behavior.

NWSheadline: RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON CST /11 AM MST/ TODAY TO 6 PM CST /5 PM MST/ THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 061...062...074 AND 084
